SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.lightModel.lightTableRelated

Class LightGame

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.lightModel.lightTableRelated.LightGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
Differentiable, Serializable
public class LightGame extends Object implements Differentiable
This class represents the game seen by the view. It contains all the information that the view needs to render the game.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    LightGame()
    Constructor of the class Initialize the lightGameParty, the codexMap, the hand, the handOthers, the decks, the publicObjective and the winners

    • LightGame

      public LightGame()
      Constructor of the class Initialize the lightGameParty, the codexMap, the hand, the handOthers, the decks, the publicObjective and the winners

  • Method Details

    • addObjective

      public void addObjective(LightCard objective)
      Add a public objective to the game in the first empty slot of the publicObjective array Notify the lightDeck observers of the update
      Parameters:
      objective - the lightCard of the public objective to add

    • getPublicObjective

      public LightCard[] getPublicObjective()
      Returns:
      the pointer to the publicObjective array

      Returns:
      the pointer to the LightHand object

      public Map<String,LightCodex> getCodexMap()
      Returns:
      the pointer to the codexMap map

    • addOtherHand

      public void addOtherHand(String owner, LightBack card)
      Update the other of another player. If the player is not in the handOthers map, it adds him
      Parameters:
      owner - the nickname of the owner of the hand
      card - the lightBack of the card to add

    • gameInitialization

      public void gameInitialization(List<String> owners)
      Update the lightGame by adding each player received as parameter. Populate the codexMap by putting the player's nickname as key and a new LightCodex as value. If the player is not the client, populate the handOthers map by putting the player's nickname as key and a new LightHandOthers as value.

    • getResourceDeck

      public LightDeck getResourceDeck()
      return the ResourceDeck

    • getGoldDeck

      public LightDeck getGoldDeck()
      return the GoldDeck

    • setTopDeck

      public void setTopDeck(LightBack back, DrawableCard type)
      Update the lightDeck (type) by changing the top card of the deck of the type received as parameter
      Parameters:
      back - the lightBack of the card that need to be set as topDeck
      type - the type of the deck that need to be updated

    • updateHandPlayability

      public void updateHandPlayability(LightCard card, Boolean playability)
      Update the hand by changing the playability of the card received as parameter
      Parameters:
      card - the card to update
      playability - the new playability of such card

    • setDeckBuffer

      public void setDeckBuffer(LightCard card, DrawableCard type, Integer position)
      Update the lightDeck (type) by substituting a card in the buffer with a new one
      Parameters:
      card - the new card in the buffer to add
      position - the position where to add the new card and remove the old one (0 or 1)

    • setGameName

      public void setGameName(String gameName)
      Update the lightGameParty by setting the gameName
      Parameters:
      gameName - the name of the game

    • setActivePlayer

      public void setActivePlayer(String player)
      Update the lightGameParty by setting player as active
      Parameters:
      player - the nickname of the player to be set as active

    • setInactivePlayer

      public void setInactivePlayer(String player)
      Update the lightGameParty by setting player as inactive
      Parameters:
      player - the nickname of the player to be set as inactive

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer(String player)
      Update the lightGameParty by setting the player as the current one
      Parameters:
      player - the nickname of the player to be set as current

    • setSecretObjective

      public void setSecretObjective(LightCard secretObjective)
      Update the hand by adding a secretObjective to it
      Parameters:
      secretObjective - the secretObjective to add

      Parameters:

    • setPoint

      public void setPoint(int points, String nickname)
      Update the lightCodex of the player by updating the points
      Parameters:
      points - the new points of the player
      nickname - the nickname of the owner of the codex

    • setFirstPlayerName

      public void setFirstPlayerName(String firstPlayer)
      Update the lightGameParty by setting the first player
      Parameters:
      firstPlayer - the nick of the first player

    • addPlayerColor

      public void addPlayerColor(String nickname, PawnColors color)
      Update the lightGameParty by setting the pawnColor chosen by the player
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nick of the player who chose the color
      color - the PawnColor chosen by the player

    • setPawnChoices

      public void setPawnChoices(List<PawnColors> pawnColorsList)
      Update the lightGameParty by setting the pawnChoices
      Parameters:
      pawnColorsList - the list of pawnColors to set

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(String nickname)
      Entirely remove a player from the game. Remove his codex and his hand from the maps. Also remove him from the lightGameParty
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player to remove

    • setFrontier

      public void setFrontier(LightFrontier lightFrontier, String nickname)
      Update the codex of the player by updating his frontier
      Parameters:
      lightFrontier - the new frontier of the player
      nickname - the nickname of the player

    • setCollectable

      public void setCollectable(Map<Collectable,Integer> collectables, String nickname)
      Update the codex of the player by updating his collectables
      Parameters:
      collectables - the new collectables of the player
      nickname - the nickname of the player

      public String getCurrentPlayer()
      Return the nickname of the current player

      public void setYourName(String yourName)
      Set the nickname of the client in the lightGameParty

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Reset the lightGame by creating new instances of all the objects Create a new instance of: lightGameParty, codexMap, hand, handOthers, decks and winners
